did.abstract: Ed Saunders served the University of Michigan in many capacities, including as Director of the Microcomputer Education Center (1985-1986) and Director of the Information Technology Division's Office of Instructional Technology (1990-1997). Papers include department materials, department publications, and correspondence regarding the development of instructional technology use at the University of Michigan.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The record group was donated by Ed Saunders (donor no. 10924) in September 2012.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Ed Saunders papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Ed Saunders joined the University of Michigan's School of Education in 1981 after serving several years in Wyoming (Mich.) and Grand Rapids (Mich.) public schools.1 He served as a Senior Instructional Associate and Media Consultant at the School of Education's Instructional Strategy Services (1981-1984) and as the Dean's Assistant for Technology (1984-1985). He was later appointed Director of the Microcomputer Education Center (1985-1986), Associate Director of the Computing Center for User Services (1986-1990), and as the Director of the Information Technology Division's Office of Instructional Technology (1990-1997).2 Since 1997 he has served as Deputy Director of the University of Michigan Center for Health Communications Research (CHCR), however these years are not represented in the collection.
Arabic Bilingual-Instructional Technology Grant, 1986-1984, box 1, folder 1, Ed Saunders, records, Bentley Historical Library.
Saunders, Ed, e-mail message to Nancy Deromedi, July 31, 2012.
"Edward W. Saunders," University of Michigan Center for Health Communications Research, accessed September 30, 2014, http://chcr.umich.edu/person.php?id=474.

arrangement.p: The collection consists of three series representing Saunders' collection of department materials: School of Education, Computing Center, and Information Technology Division.

scopecontent.p: This collection follows Ed Saunders' career at the University of Michigan and includes Saunders' collection of department materials and correspondence. His collections primarily focus on University of Michigan projects aimed at promoting interactive learning with technology.

controlaccess.subject: Information technology.

controlaccess.head: Subjects - Visual Materials:
controlaccess.corpname: University of Michigan. School of Education.

scopecontent.p: The School of Education series, 1986-1984 (0.3 linear feet) consists of a grant proposal and two videocassettes. The grant funded instructional technology use in Arabic-English bilingual education at University of Michigan and includes contextual information about Arabic speaking immigrant communities and available social services in Michigan. The two U-matic videocassettes contain several films by Clark Trow. The first videocassette includes the films "Denmark and its folk Schools", "German Schools and German Youth," "Leningrad and Moscow," and "Handicapped Children and Clinical Types." The second videocassette includes "School of Education Personnel and Activities," "American Experimental Schools," and "American and European Psychologists."

The Computing Center series, 1985-1988 (0.5 linear feet) includes committee records, program records, and several reports. Researchers should note that this series contains University of Michigan's submissions to Apple's Design of the Personal Computer of the Year 2000 competition, where cross-discipline student teams submitted proposals for futuristic personal computer designs. This series also documents the user services support report, a multi-year effort in both the Computing Center and Information Technology Division evaluating user relations on campus.

did.unittitle: Design of the Personal Computer of the Year 2000, 1987
Report to the Computing Policy Committee May 12, 1987
Information Technology Division (ITD) user services project 1985-1987

scopecontent.p: The Information Technology Division series, 1988-1997 (0.8 linear feet plus one outsize folder) documents both U-M's Information Technology Division and its Office of Instructional Technology. This series includes correspondence, proposals, publications, and other associated materials. Included are planning and evaluation documents for Educom '89, a large instructional technology conference held at the University of Michigan. Also included are materials related to VIDS (Video Interactive Distribution System), a project by the Office of Instructional Technology to install an interactive multimedia network on campus.

did.unittitle: University of Michigan evaluation guidelines for instructional technology projects February 1995
